701294f-a.title: Bronx: Independence Avenue - Palisade Avenue
701294f-a.text:
Independence Ave., east side, between Palisade Ave. and Kappock
Street, showing in a set of two views, the Edgehill Church. (Pres.)
The view is in a northerly direction.
May 25, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.
701294f-a.folder: Independence Avenue & Palisade Avenue, Bronx, NY

701294f-b.title: Bronx: Independence Avenue - Palisade Avenue
701294f-b.text:
Independence Ave., east side, between Palisade Ave. and Kappock
Street, showing in a set of two views, the Edgehill Church. (Pres.)
The view is in a northerly direction.
May 25, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.
701294f-b.folder: Independence Avenue & Palisade Avenue, Bronx, NY

701563f-b.title: Bronx: Palisade Avenue - Independence Avenue
701563f-b.text:
2505 Palisade Avenue, south side, east of Independence
Avenue, showing an old frame house, on Spuyten Duyvil Hill.
It belonged to G. E. Mann in 1879, and to D. B. Cox in 1900.
The view is eastward toward the Bronx end of the Henry Hudson
Bridge. Palisade Avenue is the road on the left, with fence.
May 25, 1937
P. L. Sperr
701563f-b.folder: Palisade Avenue & Independence Avenue, Bronx, NY

701293f-b.title: Bronx: Independence Avenue - Palisade Avenue
701293f-b.text:
(1)
Independence Avenue (lower left corner across face of view),
north from Palisade Avenue, showing part of Spuyten Duyvil Hill,
in the Bronx, west of the Henry ~Sudson Bridge. In the right
background, at W. 227th Street, is the Henry Hudson Monument;
on the left, among the trees, is the Berrien House, dating back
to pre-Hevolutionary days.
May 25, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the same area.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NWcg ~o 76
0i.  (u) ~' ~ 112
A more extensive view of Spuyten Duyvil Hill, with the
Henry Hudson Bridge appearing on the right. In the lower left
hand corner is the Spuyten Duyvil station of the New York
Central Railroad and in the center background, perched atop the
hill, is the new St. Frances Schervier Hospital, Catholic in-
stitution for the aged.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
90D ES:

701564f-a.title: Bronx: Palisade Avenue - Independence Avenue
701564f-a.text:
Palisade Ave. (foreground), at the N.E. corner of Independence
Ave., showing a 2-story stucco house occupying that site. Across the
roof of the house, in the background, is the I.G. Johnson Mansion,
on a lofty hill at the S.E. corner of Henry Eudson Parkway and Eappock
Street. The driveway on which the truck is parked is lIndependeame
Ave. The G.W. Bromley map of 1924 as ravised to September 1932 shows
the house to be on block 3407, 1ot Ww. 201.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
